what: My First Package Greets a User With Optional Baked Goods
title: My First Package Greets a User With Optional Baked Goods
text: goal mypkg first package! Yay! tell name whether want recommendation something bake, greet suggest part recipe baked_goods dataset (included). tell want full recipe, tell amounts ingredients recipe. package modified workshop “Workshop 3: Making first R package” hosted Eric R. Scott 2023 SORTEE conference.

title: My First Package Greets a User With Optional Baked Goods
text: can install development version mypkg like :

title: My First Package Greets a User With Optional Baked Goods
text: See examples function without names & baked good requests.
code: library(mypkg) ## basic example code  #Default greet()  #Supply user name argument only greet("Annie")  #Supply name and ask for a recommendation gret(name = "Annie", bakedgood = TRUE)

title: Cupcake and Muffin Ingredients — baked_goods
text: Recipe info allrecipes many delicious cupcakes muffins

title: Cupcake and Muffin Ingredients — baked_goods
text: data frame 870 rows 4 columns: type Muffin cupcake recipe_id Unique numeric identifier recipe ingredient Ingredient amount_cups Amount ingredient cups

title: Greet a user — greet
text: function greets user tell name. can optionally ask recommend random baked good baked_goods dataset. ask baked good, tell amount ingredient need make recipe number reference. Super optionally, can ask ingredients full recipe. Defaults: function greet "User" include baking recommendations.

title: Greet a user — greet
text: name character; name user bakedgood logic; true false fullrecipe logic; true false

title: Greet a user — greet
text: nothing! just prints greeting, want, suggestion baked good & ingredient needed make . feeling ambitious, ask full recipe

title: Greet a user — greet
code: #Default use greet() #> [1] "Hello \033[36mUser\033[39m!"  #Supply user name greet("Annie") #> [1] "Hello \033[36mAnnie\033[39m!"  #Supply user name and ask for a baked good recommendation (bakedgood = TRUE) greet(name = "Annie", bakedgood = TRUE) #> [1] "Hello \033[36mAnnie\033[39m! You should make a Cupcake with 0.0026041625 cups of baking powder. This is recipe 137363."  #Supply user name, ask for recommendation, and ask for full recipe (fullrecipe = TRUE) greet(name = "Annie", bakedgood = "TRUE", fullrecipe = "TRUE") #> Hello Annie! You should make a Cupcake with 0.000434027083333333 cups of salt. This is recipe 262507./nThis recipe also uses the the following ingredients:/nc("Cupcake", "Cupcake", "Cupcake", "Cupcake", "Cupcake", "Cupcake", "Cupcake", "Cupcake", "Cupcake", "Cupcake", "Cupcake", "Cupcake")/nc(262507, 262507, 262507, 262507, 262507, 262507, 262507, 262507, 262507, 262507, 262507, 262507)/nc("baking powder", "cream cheese", "eggs", "flour", "fruit", "fruit juice", "milk", "nut", "oil", "salt", "sugar", "vanilla")/nc(0.0026041625, 0.0416666666666667, 0.166666666666667, 0.125, 0.00347221666666666, 0.0182291625, 0.0416666666666667, 0.0833333333333333, 0.0625, 0.000434027083333333, 0.208333333333333, 0.00173610833333333)
